title: Ice Cruise of the Baltic Fleet
text:
The Ice Cruise of the Baltic Fleet () was an operation which transferred the ships of the <a href="Baltic%20Fleet">Baltic Fleet</a> of the <a href="Imperial%20Russian%20Navy">Imperial Russian Navy</a> from their bases at <a href="Tallinn">Tallinn</a>, at the time known as Reval (), and <a href="Helsinki">Helsinki</a> to <a href="Kronstadt">Kronstadt</a> in 1918.
Operation.
On 17 February 1918 <a href="Vladimir%20Lenin">Vladimir Lenin</a> ordered the ships of the Baltic Fleet to leave their bases at <a href="Tallinn">Tallinn</a> and sail to <a href="Helsinki">Helsinki</a>. On 19 February, due to a new German offensive, the Baltic Fleet ordered the further transfer of ships located in Helsinki to <a href="Kronstadt">Kronstadt</a>. On the same day ships started leaving Tallinn. A general evacuation began on 22 February, with a group of four ships, led by the icebreaker <a href="Yermak%20%281898%20icebreaker%29">"Yermak"</a>, departing for Helsinki. They were followed on 24 February by a convoy of transport ships, accompanied by two submarines, three <a href="minesweeper">minesweeper</a>s and a <a href="minelayer">minelayer</a>.
By the time German troops entered Reval on 25 February, most of the Russian ships had already left, escorted by the <a href="icebreaker">icebreaker</a>s "Yermak", "<a href="Tarmo%20%281907%20icebreaker%29">Tarmo</a>" and "<a href="Suur%20T%C3%B5ll%20%28icebreaker%29">Volynets</a>". The operation, superintended by <a href="Alexey%20Schastny">Alexey Schastny</a>, succeeded in evacuating the bulk of the Baltic Fleet to Helsinki, where all of the ships had arrived by 5 March, with the exception of the submarine "<a href="Edinorog">Edinorog</a>", which had been crushed by ice.
On 12–13 April, German forces captured Helsinki. Russian sailors scuttled four submarines in <a href="Hanko%2C%20Finland">Hanko</a> harbour on 3 April, just before the 10,000-strong German <a href="Baltic%20Sea%20Division">Baltic Sea Division</a> landed in support of the <a href="White%20Guard%20%28Finland%29">White Guard</a>. The submarines—<a href="Russian%20submarine%20AG-11">"AG 11"</a>, , "AG 15" and —were made by <a href="General%20Dynamics%20Electric%20Boat">Electric Boat Co.</a> in the <a href="United%20States">United States</a>. The German Army later returned all of the ships captured in Helsinki under the terms of the <a href="treaty%20of%20Brest-Litovsk">treaty of Brest-Litovsk</a>.
All of the evacuated ships had reached Kronstadt or <a href="Saint%20Petersburg">Petrograd</a> by 22 April.
Importance.
The ships transferred included:
Two <a href="air%20force">air force</a> <a href="brigade">brigade</a>s and large amounts of military equipment were also transferred. The transferred ships went on to play an important role in the defence of Petrograd.
